summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 4, 2021, with a Lock and Security Supervisor (Acting Facilities Manager) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York. The memorandum includes attachments such as the interview transcript, signed forms, and related documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; he died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of MCC Lock and Security Supervisor
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of the Lock and Security Supervisor (Acting Facilities Manager) at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email regarding Facilities Manager Out of Office
events.description: An email dated August 9, 2019, references the Facilities Manager being out of office; this document is attached to the OIG memorandum.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (likely referring to OIG office location)
keyFacts: The document is part of the OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
A voluntary interview was conducted on August 4, 2021, with the Lock and Security Supervisor (who served as Acting Facilities Manager) at MCC New York.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the transcript is attached to this memorandum along with other documents like a signed warnings form and an email from August 9, 2019.
The memorandum explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
Jeffrey Epstein's BOP register number is listed as 76318-054.
